trans-unit.source: Wait for a browser page load to complete before returning

seg-source.mrk: Wait for a browser page load to complete before returning

target.mrk: Wait for a browser page load to complete before returning

trans-unit.source: Parameters
Object variable of an InternetExplorer.Application or DOM element
[optional] Milliseconds to wait before checking status

seg-source.mrk: Milliseconds to wait before checking status

target.mrk: Milliseconds to wait before checking status

trans-unit.source: [optional] Period of time to wait before exiting function (default = 300000 ms aka 5 min)

seg-source.mrk: Period of time to wait before exiting function (default = 300000 ms aka 5 min)

target.mrk: Period of time to wait before exiting function (default = 300000 ms aka 5 min)

trans-unit.source: Return Value
0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

seg-source.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

target.mrk: 0 and sets the @error flag to non-zero.

trans-unit.source: @error:
1 ($_IEStatus_GeneralError) - General Error
3 ($_IEStatus_InvalidDataType) - Invalid Data Type
4 ($_IEStatus_InvalidObjectType) - Invalid Object Type
6 ($_IEStatus_LoadWaitTimeout) - Load Wait Timeout
8 ($_IEStatus_AccessIsDenied) - Access Is Denied
9 ($_IEStatus_ClientDisconnected) - Client Disconnected
@extended:
Contains invalid parameter number
Remarks
Several IE.au3 functions call _IELoadWait() automatically (e.g. _IECreate(), _IENavigate() etc.).

seg-source.mrk: Several IE.au3 functions call _IELoadWait() automatically (e.g.

target.mrk: Several IE.au3 functions call _IELoadWait() automatically (e.g.

trans-unit.source: Most functions that do this also allow you to turn this off with a $fWait parameter if you do not want the wait or if you want to call it yourself.

seg-source.mrk: Most functions that do this also allow you to turn this off with a $fWait parameter if you do not want the wait or if you want to call it yourself.

target.mrk: Most functions that do this also allow you to turn this off with a $fWait parameter if you do not want the wait or if you want to call it yourself.

trans-unit.source: When document objects or DOM elements are passed to _IELoadWait(), it will check the readyState of the container elements up to and including the parentWindow.

seg-source.mrk: When document objects or DOM elements are passed to _IELoadWait(), it will check the readyState of the container elements up to and including the parentWindow.

target.mrk: When document objects or DOM elements are passed to _IELoadWait(), it will check the readyState of the container elements up to and including the parentWindow.

trans-unit.source: Browser scripting security restrictions may sometimes prevent _IELoadWait() from guaranteeing that a page is fully loaded and can occasionally result in untrapped errors.

seg-source.mrk: Browser scripting security restrictions may sometimes prevent _IELoadWait() from guaranteeing that a page is fully loaded and can occasionally result in untrapped errors.

target.mrk: Browser scripting security restrictions may sometimes prevent _IELoadWait() from guaranteeing that a page is fully loaded and can occasionally result in untrapped errors.

trans-unit.source: In these cases you may need to avoid calling _IELoadWait() and attempt to employ other methods of insuring that the page load has completed.

seg-source.mrk: In these cases you may need to avoid calling _IELoadWait() and attempt to employ other methods of insuring that the page load has completed.

target.mrk: In these cases you may need to avoid calling _IELoadWait() and attempt to employ other methods of insuring that the page load has completed.

trans-unit.source: These methods might include using a Sleep command, examining browser status bar text and other methods. When using functions that call _IELoadWait() for objects other than the InternetExplorer (browser) object, you may also be successful by calling _IELoadWait() for the browser yourself (e.g. _IELoadWait($oIE)).

seg-source.mrk: These methods might include using a Sleep command, examining browser status bar text and other methods.
When using functions that call _IELoadWait() for objects other than the InternetExplorer (browser) object, you may also be successful by calling _IELoadWait() for the browser yourself (e.g.

target.mrk: These methods might include using a Sleep command, examining browser status bar text and other methods.
When using functions that call _IELoadWait() for objects other than the InternetExplorer (browser) object, you may also be successful by calling _IELoadWait() for the browser yourself (e.g.

trans-unit.source: The most common causes of trouble are page redirects and cross-site scripting security restrictions associated with frames. Page re-writing techniques employed by some applications (e.g. Gmail) can also cause trouble here.

seg-source.mrk: The most common causes of trouble are page redirects and cross-site scripting security restrictions associated with frames.
Page re-writing techniques employed by some applications (e.g.
Gmail) can also cause trouble here.

target.mrk: The most common causes of trouble are page redirects and cross-site scripting security restrictions associated with frames.
Page re-writing techniques employed by some applications (e.g.
Gmail) can also cause trouble here.

Open the AutoIt forum page, tab to the "View new posts"

target.mrk: link and activate the link with the enter key.
